pageContext.claim: “We've really, you know, terminated a lot of the Obamacare, as it was referred to.”
pageContext.analysis: The 2017 Trump tax bill, starting in 2019, effectively eliminates the mandate that required people to pay a penalty if they chose not to buy health insurance. (A waiver was available for people under a certain income level.) The penalty must still be paid in 2017 and 2018. Other than the individual mandate, Trump has not “terminated a lot of Obamacare.”
